a: It is found that on the first two types of plastic, the second test shows a greater stretch than the first (_2cm for the first, 1cm for the second). Strangerly, the third type of plastic is not stretched but shortened. The fourth was not altered. The four plastics therefore have a very different reaction to stretching. b: he could have allowed the plastics to stretch longer than 5min to have more meaningful data. He should also have measured the materials before the first stretching. B is :

Take a sample of a type of plastic and measure its length.  Collect the upper edge of the plastic sample onto a table so that it is freely suspended on the side of the table.  Fix a pince on the lower edge of the plastic sample.  Add weights to the pince and let them hang for five minutes.  Remove the weights and pince, and measure the length of plastic types.
